item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games for Feeling Fear, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Some sandbox titles take scary immersion to the next level, keeping players on edge.
  • Sandbox games like Pathologic 2 and Sons of the Forest excel at terrorizing players, offering immersive experiences.
  • Progress in Project Zomboid is tense due to hardcore survival mechanics, with every mistake potentially ending the player's run.

Every immersive open-world game can find it easy to scare players. So, it's natural to be shocked by enemy ambushes or sudden reveals that players don't expect. However, some sandbox titles take this scary immersion to the next level.

Even if things are going fine in these games, players will still be dreading the horrors that can unfold with even a single misstep. It ensures that the gameplay loop doesn't get tiring and remains fresh enough to keep players on the edge of their seats as they battle their fears.

8 Dredge

At High Terror Levels, This Game is Genuinely Terrifying

Dredge
10
8.2 /10
Released
March 31, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Black Salt Games
Publisher(s)
Team17
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
4 Images
Powered by

Players who get accustomed to the gameplay loop of Dredge may talk a lot about how upgrades make the game easier to handle, but this still applies when they're around the lighthouse. When they have to venture to different corners of the map to progress the story, things become far more complicated.

Terror can build at a faster pace than most players would assume, causing them to see horrifying visions and experience sudden attacks that can lead to a game over. Along with this, the various corners of the map house nightmarish dangers that can be a pain to deal with at times, forcing players to be smart about how they move around in these zones without getting their hulls smashed in.

7 Pathologic 2

The Title's Surreal Horror Will Creep Underneath the Player's Skin

Pathologic 2
9.3 /10
Released
May 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ice-Pick Lodge
Publisher(s)
tinyBuild
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
8 Images
Powered by

The first thing players will notice about Pathologic 2 is how surreal this experience is. The game doesn't hide its theatrical inspirations and actively revels in them, ensuring that players will experience a sense of unease no matter where they go in this tough open-world RPG.

To make things worse, the death mechanic is so punishing that players will hate putting themselves in a losing position. Every combat encounter is stressful, with players fearing the worst if they bite off more than they can chew and die, leading to them suffering from a permanent debuff that will last for the rest of their run.

6 Sons of the Forest

The Overbearing Threat of the Cannibals is Hard to Fathom

Sons of the Forest
8.6 /10
Released
February 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Endnight Games
Publisher(s)
Newnight
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Sons of the Forest is a hard-as-nails survival horror game where the threat of death looms over the player every step of the way. Even after being prudent about scavenging everything in sight and bolstering the base, there's a part of players that will always fear what might happen if things implode.

It doesn't help that the game's cannibals are disturbing and love rushing at players in a bloodthirsty manner. This might cause them to panic and lose their lives, which is the last thing anyone would want after making so much valuable progress in this game.

5 STALKER: Clear Sky

The Toughest Game in This Hard-as-Nails Survival Horror Franchise by a Country Mile

S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky
7.5 /10
Released
September 15, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
GSC Game World
Publisher(s)
GSC Game World, Deep Silver
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

The STALKER games are known to be devilishly hard as is, so it says a lot that fans comfortably rate Clear Sky as the hardest one of the lot. The game has one of the most agonizingly hard openings in video game history, with players having very little direction about where they must go.

Even after the world opens up, Clear Sky is a relentlessly hard experience that will punish players for getting too greedy or lackadaisical. Death can arrive at a moment's notice in surprising fashion, forcing players to be wary of every step they take and seek the safety of a shelter whenever possible.

4 Project Zomboid

Progress in This Game is Special and Makes Gameplay Nerve-Wracking

Project Zomboid
9.2 /10
Released
November 8, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
The Indie Stone
Publisher(s)
The Indie Stone
Platform(s)
PC
7 Images
Powered by

The sheer tension present in Project Zomboid , coupled with its hardcore survival mechanics, means that players will feel the tension rising every day they manage to remain alive. The zombies are relentless, and a single bite will end a player's run, making it clear that no one is getting any leeway in this hard-as-nails title.

No matter how many skills players raise, a single mistake can prove costly in Project Zomboid . The gameplay mechanics alone ensure that players will feel tense in every playthrough, even if the graphics may seem rudimentary at first glance.

3 Metro Exodus

The Overbearing Horrors of This World Can Be Hard to Digest

Metro Exodus
8.6 /10
Released
February 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
4A Games
Publisher(s)
Deep Silver
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Metro Exodus doesn't shy away from making it clear that players are not in for an easy time. The difficulty of the past two titles is mostly carried over in this horror-focused title that is full of oppressive dangers. While the game isn't a fully open-world title, it features several vast open-world areas that are sure to keep tensions high and survivability low for all but the most cautious.

Artyom must be wary of enemies and ensure that his equipment isn't severely damaged by them. Players who may start getting comfortable with the open-world zones will sing a different tune when the game's linear levels appear to scare players out of their wits, emulating the best (and most horrifying) moments of Metro 2033 and Last Light .

2 Subnautica

The Game's Exploration Will Put Players' Thalassophobia to the Test

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Gearbox Publishing
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Subnautica is one of the greatest survival games ever made, but there's a reason why some players are scared to check this game out. It may be an excellent title in its own right, but the horror of exploring a deadly alien ocean and its unknown waters is so palpable that many are turned away within the first hours.

While this is understandable, players are robbing themselves of one of the most immersive and engaging survival games of all time if they are shying away from playing Subnautica . Yes, the thalassophobia in this game is real... but so is the wondrous sense of exploration and progression that makes this a rewarding experienceonce players conquer their fears.

1 Outer Wilds

This Masterful Open-World Game Has Its Scary Moments, Especially in the Echoes of the Eye Expansion

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Mobius Digital
Publisher(s)
Annapurna Interactive
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Despite being an exploration-puzzle game at heart, it's amazing just how scary Outer Wilds can get. There are moments in the game that will genuinely shock players and force them to rethink their approach if they don't want to get scared again (people familiar with this game know what this statement is alluding to).

On top of this, the brilliant Echoes of the Eye expansion is so scary that developers actually added an option to tone down the scares of this DLC. This alone should illustrate that Outer Wilds is more than capable of scaring players, although it's never done cheaply and proves just how immersive this title is once players fall in love with the gameplay loop.

item.title: Persona 3 Fans Can Read the Manga Adaptation's First Volume for Free
item.description:
Fans of Persona 3 can read the entirety of the first volume of the manga in English for free. The offer will only be available for a limited time, so Persona 3 fans shouldn't miss this opportunity.

While it didn't reach the heights of Persona 5 's worldwide popularity, Persona 3 is a well-loved entry in the long-running RPG franchise. The game has seen spin-offs, new versions, and ports to modern consoles, bringing the story of the SEES, Tartarus, and the Dark Hour to players everywhere.

Persona 3 Manga Volume 1 is Free - For a While

One of the many adaptations of Persona 3 is its original manga, and now fans can read the entirety of volume one for free. According to the manga's physical listings, this amounts to 162 pages, giving players a good amount to dive into. This offer comes courtesy of Atlus, and notes that this volume is being given away as a way of expressing gratitude to the Persona 3 Reload community. This opportunity is only available for a "limited time," by Atlus has not specified for exactly how long. Fans can read the first volume on the official Persona 3 Reload Sega site. While the remainder of the manga isn't free to read, it can be acquired online digitally, or as a physical book from online and offline bookstores.

One thing worth noting is that the manga began its western release in 2016, so it predates the Persona 3 Reload remake considerably. As such, fans shouldn't expect any additional content present in the remake to be a part of the manga's story. The manga was penned by Shuji Sogabe, originally launching way back in 2007, and running on and off until its completion in 2017. This same artist would go on to create the Persona 4 manga, which is also available for purchase in the west. Persona 5 is also available in manga format, though with a different author.

This move is likely also being made to help bring attention to the upcoming release of Persona 3 Reload on Switch 2. Nintendo fans have been waiting for an opportunity to play the game for themselves, though the nature of its release hasn't been without controversy. Persona 3 Reload will be on a Game-Key Card on Switch 2, or in other words, the game's files won't be on the physical version's cartridge. Regardless, those who want to play it on Nintendo's latest console won't have to wait long, as Persona 3 Reload will release on October 23, 2025 for the hybrid game system.

13
9.2 /10
9 /10

Persona 3 Reload

item.title: Best Single-Player Games That Are Free
item.description:
Summary

  • Some free single-player games worth checking out are Helltaker and Sheepy: A Short Adventure .
  • Yume Nikki and Doki Doki Literature Club! are two classic indie games with unique storytelling and gameplay.
  • Grimhook offers fast-paced action with a satisfying grappling hook mechanic in a 3D setting.

Gaming is one of the most expensive hobbies in the world right now, so its no surprise that people are constantly trying to find new ways of playing good games without spending a cent. The only problem is that most free games on the market are either filled to the brim with microtransactions and/or can only be played in multiplayer.

Consumers who want to enjoy a solid single-player video game without spending money may feel alienated at first, but fortunately for them, there are actually some excellent offerings out there: its just a matter of knowing exactly where to look for them. The following single-player games are completely free , and they are all definitely worth checking out.

Yume Nikki

One Of The Most Important Indie Games Ever Made

Yume Nikki
Adventure
Systems
Released
June 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Back in the early 2000s, Japanese developer Kikiyama made a huge impact on the industry by releasing one of the very first indie video games, simply titled Yume Nikki . While it was made with RPG Maker 2003 (which is immediately evident by its graphic style), this is not really a conventional RPG at all. Its more of an adventure game with an isometric perspective and a few horror elements.

Yume Nikki is all about a young girl named Madotsuki and her journey through her own dreams, which very quickly get surreal, psychedelic, and disturbing. This is one of the most distinctive video games ever made, and it directly inspired many other great indie RPGs that came after, like Undertale and Omori . Fortunately for those whore interested, Yume Nikki has always been 100% free to download, but now its also available on Steam, which has made it even more accessible.

Doki Doki Literature Club!

A Brilliant Visual Novel With A Mind-Blowing Twist

Doki Doki Literature Club!
10 /10
Released
September 22, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

3 Images
Powered by

While not all gamers enjoy visual novels, Doki Doki Literature Club! is a great game that everybody should experience once in their lives. Created by indie developer Dan Salvato over the course of two years, Doki Doki Literature Club! went viral on the internet when it was first launched, and it is still being discussed to this day.

Unfortunately, its almost impossible to explain what makes this game so brilliant without spoiling the mind-blowing plot twists that are hiding behind its cutesy and colorful faade, but anybody whos interested should try it out for themselves before they get spoiled. Its important to point out that this game has an enhanced port with additional content titled Doki Doki Literature Club Plus! that does cost money, but the original 2017 version is completely free.

Deltarune (Chapters 1 & 2)

Undertales Excellent Spiritual Successor

Deltarune
35
9.5 /10
Released
October 31, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Language, Suggestive Themes, Mild Blood, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

It's safe to say that most gamers nowadays are familiar with developer Toby Fox, the creator of Undertale . Back in 2019, he shocked his massive fan base by shadow-dropping a new game titled Deltarune , and the best part is that it was (and still is) completely free. However, as anybody who played it until the end quickly discovered, this initial release was just Chapter 1 of an ongoing project.

Toby Fox later released Deltarune Chapter 2 in 2021, which was also free, and only recently, in June 2025, he finally launched Chapters 3 and 4, which are paid content. However, the first two chapters of Deltarune are still completely free, which is great because this is one of the best indie RPGs currently on the market. With an engaging storyline, a cast of colorful and lovable characters, brilliant mechanics that parody the RPG genre, and one of the catchiest soundtracks ever made, Deltarune would be a must pay even with a price tag. The fact that it's free only makes it more enticing.

Astro's Playroom

The Best Pack-In Game Of This Generation

Astro's Playroom
9.4 /10
Released
November 12, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Pack-in video games (as in, games that come free with a console launch) are a dying art today, which is why Sony blew the minds of consumers when it launched the PlayStation 5 in 2020, and it came with a free game pre-installed. While Astro's Playroom is basically a tech demo meant to show players what the PS5 and its DualSense controller can do, it's actually a full game with hours worth of content.

In Astro's Playroom , players take control of the titular character as he delves inside the PS5 console by exploring four different levels full of collectibles. This is a colorful and accessible 3D platformer that was clearly made with a lot of love and care for the PlayStation brand, but many PS5 users are not even aware that it exists. Astro's Playroom is such a great free game that it even received a direct sequel, simply titled Astro Bot , which won Game of the Year in 2024.

Helltaker

A Fun Puzzle-Adventure Game About Sharply Dressed Demon Girls

Released
May 11, 2020
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Even though Helltaker may seem like a weird dating sim at first, its impossible to deny how entertaining, refreshing, and creative it is. Solo developer ukasz Piskorz took the indie scene by storm back in 2020 when he released this unique project for free, in which the player has to solve a series of well-designed puzzles in order to reach a demon girl at the end of each level.

Helltaker quickly gained a sizable following, not only because of its engaging gameplay, but also due to its solid character design and detailed 2D animation. After this huge success, Piskorz went on to make a bullet hell game titled Awaria , which is also free and worth checking out.

Sheepy: A Short Adventure

A Beautiful But Ominous Pixel Platformer

Sheepy: A Short Adventure
Platformer
Systems
Released
February 6, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

3 Images
Powered by

Gamers who are looking for a beautiful and distinctive experience but don't want to spend any money to get it should definitely give Sheepy: A Short Adventure a try. A very small team made this indie 2D platformer, and the first thing about it that immediately pops out is its outstanding presentation.

Sheepy: A Short Adventure was brought to life with incredibly detailed sprite work for both its titular protagonist and its environments, and everything looks way too good for a game that is 100% free. On top of that, its atmosphere is oddly somber, its soundtrack is surprisingly captivating, and, while the gameplay is quite simple, it's entertaining enough to keep players engaged throughout the entirety of its short duration.

The Murder Of Sonic The Hedgehog

This Hilarious April Fools' Gag Is Perfect For Any Sonic Fan

The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog
8.5 /10
Released
March 31, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Back on April 1st, 2023, Sega released a freeware game titled The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog, and, for something that was just supposed to be a silly April Fools' gag, a lot of effort and care clearly went into its development. Because of this, The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog is a legitimately great game that most peopleespecially those who are fans of the Blue Blurshould experience on their own.

The player takes control of an employee aboard the Mirage Express, a train where the "Sonic Gang" is celebrating Amy Roses birthday. However, when it appears as though Sonic the Hedgehog has been murdered, it's up to the player to find out who did it. Needless to say, The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog is a tongue-in-cheek parody of murder mysteries that takes the form of an old-school point-and-click adventure. It has well-written dialogue, a hilarious sense of humor, a few fun mini-games, and countless nods and Easter Eggs that longtime Sonic fans are sure to love.

Grimhook

A Fast-Paced Action Game With A Satisfying Grappling Hook Mechanic

  • Released: December 8, 2023
  • Developer: Unlimited Fries
  • System: PC
  • Genre: First-person, Action

Most free games currently on the market seem to be 2D RPGs, platformers, or visual novels, but Unlimited Fries' Grimhook is absolutely perfect for those who may be seeking to play something more ambitious that was built with 3D graphics. As its name implies, this is a first-person action game in which the player wields a grappling hook for both platforming and combat.

Grimhook 's biggest highlight is its fluid and fast-paced movement system, which makes the exploration extremely engaging and satisfying. The entire experience is elevated further by its beautiful hand-painted art style and its striking Lovecraftian themes. Needless to say, this is all surprisingly ambitious and unique for a free product, and being able to experience such a solid game without paying a single cent feels almost criminal.

item.title: How To Build Evernight - Best Light Cones, Relics, And Eidolons In Honkai: Star Rail
item.description:
Honkai: Star Rail has released several support units that also double as sub-DPS, greatly increasing the standard of a support character. On top of Tribbie, Cipher, and Hyacine, in version 3.6, a new Remembrance support/sub-DPS also becomes available. This unit, Evernight, marks the very first 5-star persona of March 7th. Here's how to build Evernight in HSR for players who are wondering about the 5-star Remembrance March 7th.

Evernight Build Overview In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Light Cones

  1. To Evernight's Stars
  2. Make Farewells More Beautiful
  3. Memory's Curtain Never Falls
  4. The Flower Remembers
  5. Sweat Now, Cry Less
  6. Long May Rainbows Adorn The Sky

Relics Sets

  • 4pc: World-Remaking Deliverer

Planar Ornaments

  • 2pc: Bone Collection's Serene Demesne
  • 2pc: Arcadia of Woven Dreams
  • 2pc: The Wondrous BananAmusement Park

Relics Stats

  • Body: Crit DMG
  • Feet: SPD
  • Planar Sphere: Ice DMG Bonus or HP
  • Link Rope: HP or Energy Regeneration Rate

Relics Substats

  • Crit Rate, SPD, HP, Crit DMG

Best Evernight Light Cones In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

The best Light Cones for Evernight in HSR should boost her own DMG; the DMG of her memosprite, Evey; and also buff the team at the same time. For that, here are the best weapons for Evernight in Honkai: Star Rail :

Light Cones

Why It's Good

To Evernight's Stars

Evernight's signature Light Cone. It increases her HP by 30%, and her and Evey's DMG by 30%. It also buffs all ally memosprites by allowing them to ignore the 20% of the enemy's DEF.

When Evey disappears, Evernight restores 8 Energy, making it easier for her to maintain the Darkest Riddle state.

Make Farewells More Beautiful

Castorice's signature weapon. It doesn't provide buffs like most options on this list, but it greatly enhances Evernight's personal DMG.

Memory's Curtain Never Falls

Increases Evernight's SPD by 12% and the DMG dealt by all allies by 16%. A great weapon for Evernight to move more while buffing the team.

The Flower Remembers

Increases Crit DMG, which will boost Evernight's Crit DMG buff, on top of an additional Crit DMG boost for Evey.

Sweat Now, Cry Less

Increases the Crit Rate and both the DMG of Evernight and Evey. Great to boost Evernight's DPS.

Long May Rainbows Adorn The Sky

Typically equipped on Hyacine or another Remembrance, but it works for Evernight if there's no other wearer. It increases her SPD by 18% and consumes all allies' HP, including her own, which helps stack her Memoria.

However, the main highlight is the Light Cone's buff, which increases the DMG taken by all enemies by 18%. Sadly, this effect doesn't stack, meaning only one of these Light Cones can be worn to run optimally.

Best Evernight Relics In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Evernight's Skill grants Crit DMG buff to all memosprites based on her own Crit DMG . This means that stacking up Crit DMG on Evernight is a good idea. However, be mindful as too much Crit DMG will result in a diminishing return , meaning at some point, it's better to invest in other stats like Crit Rate or HP for Evernight's personal DMG, rather than focusing solely on maximizing her buff.

In her optimal team, Evernight should be able to maintain her Darkest Riddle state without Energy Regeneration Rate (ERR) Link Rope, but if she can't, players can use ERR instead of HP. Here are the best Relics for Evernight in Honkai: Star Rail .

Relic Sets

Why It's Good

World-Remaking Deliverer

Boosts Evernight Crit Rate and HP, great for her personal DPS. Additionally, it also buffs all allies' DMG by 15%.

Planar Ornament Sets

Why It's Good

Bone Collection's Serene Demesne

Increases Evernight and Evey's Crit DMG by 28%, and boosts Evernight's HP by 12%.

Arcadia of Woven Dreams

Increases Evernight and Evey's DMG by up to 12%.

The Wondrous BananAmusement Park

Increases Evernight's Crit DMG by up to 48%. There's no memosprite-specific buff, but the Crit DMG addition is still good to increase Evernight's Crit DMG buff from her Skill.

Evernight Eidolons In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Like many characters in Honkai: Star Rail , Evernight's Eidolons in HSR can solve some of her limitations and open the door to making her a more reliable support.

Eidolons

Effect

Importance

S1

Sleep Tight, the Night Dreams Long

When Evernight is on the field, if there are (4 or more)/3/2/1 enemy targets on the field, ally memosprites deal DMG equal to 120%/125%/130%/150% of their original DMG respectively.

High

S2

Listen Up, the Slumber Speaks Soft

Increases Evernight's and memosprite Evey's CRIT DMG by 40%. Each time Evernight gains "Memoria," increases the amount of "Memoria" gain by 2 point(s). When using Ultimate, additionally gains 2 Charge of "Darkest Riddle."

Priority

S4

Wake Up, the Tomorrow is Yours

While Evernight is on the field, ally memosprites' Weakness Break Efficiency increases by 25%, and the memosprite Evey's Weakness Break Efficiency additionally increases by 25%.

Medium

S6

Like This, Always

While Evernight is on the field, all ally targets' All-Type RES PEN increases by 20%. After the memosprite Evey uses "Dream, Dissolving, as Dew," Evernight gains 30% of the amount of "Memoria" consumed in this attack.

High

Is Evernight Worth It? - Honkai: Star Rail

As of HSR 3.6, Evernight is hardly worth it if players are chasing meta. She's currently limited to the Castorice + Evernight + Tribbie + Hyacine party, and the team still has some requirements on top of needing these specific characters.

For instance, Hyacine must have her signature Light Cone, Long May Rainbows Adorn The Sky , to properly synergize with Evernight. If players don't have Tribbie, they can use Remembrance MC (RMC), but this, too, will lower Evernight's value in the team. All in all, if players are wondering if Evernight is worth it in the meta, it's highly recommended to wait until the official release of Cyrene's kit .

Since Evernight relies on a team consisting of at least three Remembrance characters, Cyrene, who will be the next Remembrance unit, will lead the fate of Evernight's role in the meta. If Cyrene ends up being a replacement for RMC, similar to how Fugue can replace Harmony MC (HMC), then Evernight may have increased viability. However, if Cyrene ends up not synergizing with Evernight at all, the alternate March 7th persona likely won't dominate the meta anytime soon.

77
9.4 /10

Honkai: Star Rail

Follow
Followed
RPG
Turn-Based RPG
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 83 /100 Critics Rec: 90%
Released
April 26, 2023
ESRB
Teen / Fantasy Violence, Mild Suggestive Themes, Simulated Gambling, In-Game Purchases (Includes Random Items), Users Interact
Developer(s)
HoYoverse (Formerly miHoYo)
Publisher(s)
HoYoverse (Formerly miHoYo)
7 Images

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

item.title: Best PS1 Games With Endless Replayability
item.description:
Summary

  • Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2 revolutionized the series with manuals and a level editor for endless replayability.
  • Vagrant Story's deep crafting and New Game+ mechanics allow for hyper-specialized gear and multiple runs.
  • Castlevania: Symphony of the Night's exploration, variety, and hidden content make every playthrough unique.

The age of the PS1 was packed with one-and-done classics, but some games just refused to let go. Despite limited memory space and blocky graphics, a handful of titles created wonderful gameplay loops or branching story paths that made starting a new playthrough just as rewarding as finishing one.

Whether it was genre-defying mechanics, branching narratives, or pure player expression, these PS1 titles found ways to reinvent themselves each time players hit New Game. Here are the best PS1 games that made Game Over feel like a subtle suggestion.

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2

Manuals, Mayhem, And Millions Of Points

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2
10 /10
Released
September 20, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Neversoft
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), Windows, Sega Dreamcast, Nintendo 64, Nintendo Game Boy Color, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, iOS
Powered by

Widely considered the pinnacle of the THPS formula, Tony Hawks Pro Skater 2 introduced manuals, which allowed players to chain ground tricks for massive score chains, ushering in a new era of huge numbers and incredible skill expression. The roster featured various characters with distinct stats and unlockable boards.

Add to that the ability to create a custom skater as well as jam packed levels full of multiple objectives, hidden tapes, and high score thresholds that encourage mastery, as well as a full level editor that lets players design and save their skateparks, and its clear why Tony Hawks Pro Skater 2 is fondly remembered to this day.

Vagrant Story

Dungeon Crawling With A Blacksmiths Brain

Vagrant Story
10 /10
Released
May 15, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Animated Violence
Developer(s)
Square
Platform(s)
PS1
Powered by

With a mature, politically layered plot set in the fictional ruined city of Le Monde, Vagrant Story s gameplay blends tactical action combat with deep weapon crafting, damage types, and stat-based gear systems. Although the layout of dungeons remains the same, players can carry over weapons and key items in New Game+.

The replayability stems from building hyper-specialized gear to counter enemy types, unlocking secret areas, and experimenting with risk-reward mechanics tied to combos and affinities. The game also offers multiple weapon classes and magic types, making ample room for experimentation and replayability.

Castlevania: Symphony Of The Night

Its Dangerous To Go Alone. Take Alucard Again

Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
9.6 /10
Released
October 2, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB

The iconic 1997 2D action-platformer that helped define the Metroidvania genre features a sprawling, interconnected castle that doubles in size halfway through the story. With multiple endings and a plethora of secret bosses, its impossible to scratch the surface of everything Symphony of the Night has to offer in just one playthrough.

Alucard can equip a massive array of weapons, spells, relics, and familiars, all of which dramatically change the feel of combat. Freedom of exploration, hidden content, and the ability to do challenge runs with self-imposed gear limits all drive replayability. If all that wasnt enough, theres also Richter mode, which allows fans to play as a different character entirely, with a new moveset and abilities.

Final Fantasy Tactics

One Battlefield, Infinite Possibilities

Final Fantasy Tactics
Tactical
RPG
Systems
14
8.9 /10
Released
June 20, 1997
ESRB
t

Developer(s)
Square
Platform(s)
PS1
Powered by

A tactical take on an RPG classic, Final Fantasy Tactics carries a political war narrative and branching class system. With over 20 job classes, each with dozens of skills to unlock and combine, the possible party builds are limitless. Permadeath and terrain mechanics force players to adapt, keeping battles fresh even on repeat playthroughs.

Although the main story paths are mostly linear, the tactical variance and character customization make for a drastically different gameplay experience each time. Theres also missable hidden story battles to uncover. Final Fantasy Tactics encourages replayability not through baked-in mechanics but with sheer breadth of gameplay options, all of which are impossible to experience without hitting New Game a couple more times.

Gran Turismo 2

License To Grind (And Love It)

Gran Turismo 2
Racing
Systems
9.0 /10
Released
December 11, 1999
ESRB
e

Developer(s)
Polyphony Digital
Platform(s)
PS1
Powered by

One would be hard pressed to find a game thats as big of a step up from its predecessor as Gran Turismo 2 . Featuring over 600 cars and a complex progression system, the game was split into two discs to scratch a different itch: arcade or simulation, each one offering dozens of hours of content. It emphasized tuning, maximizing car performance, and vehicle-specific events that rewarded mastering different driving disciplines.

Replayability was fueled by collecting and upgrading different cars, tackling endurance races, and completing all license challenges with top marks. The ability to turn driving assists on or off added another layer to master. Gran Turismo 2 was the foundation on which the series cemented itself as a titan of the racing genre.

Metal Gear Solid

Big Boss Energy Never Gets Old

Metal Gear Solid
Stealth
Systems
8.0 /10
Released
October 20, 1998
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Suggestive Themes, Violence

Developer(s)
Konami Computer Entertainment Japan
Platform(s)
PS1, PC
Powered by

The stealth-action landmark from 1998, which brought cinematic storytelling in video games to the mainstream, also included plenty of content to coerce players into hitting the replay button a few times. Multiple difficulty levels are unlocked with each completion, and new AI behaviors, as well as stricter item limits.

The New Game+ mode allowed players to keep key items like the stealth camo or infinite ammo bandana, depending on which ending they chose. Post-game playthroughs also reveal alternate dialogue, different nuances to the story while also rewarding experimentation with stealth vs. combat approaches. There are also easter eggs and Kojima-style fourth wall breaks to find, making replays feel fresh.

Suikoden 2

108 Reasons To Hit New Game

Suikoden
8.0 /10
Released
December 15, 1995

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Konami
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), Sega Saturn, PC
Powered by

Though the massive cast of 108 recruitable characters was the main selling point, Suikoden 2 had a lot more than just that going for it. Even choices made in the first game can carry over to the sequel via save data, altering how some characters appear or behave. Branching dialogue and character recruitments depend on specific actions that players take or side quests they complete.

Multiple endings and late-game decisions that can change the fate of characters or whole factions make sure to give players an itch to have one more go. Suikoden 2 s replayability thrives on different party builds, trying alternate political outcomes, and seeing how different choices affect the outcomes of the war effort.

Build. Fight. Rebuild. Repeat.

Developer(s)

Platform(s)

Powered by

The third Armored Core title on the PS1 and one of the deepest mech simulators of its time, Master of Arena featured an extensive part customization system that let players build an entirely unique AC from hundreds of components. An arena mode featuring dozens of 1v1 battles against rival ACs with unique designs and tactics heavily encourages experimentation in terms of build and playstyle.

The story mode also included branching missions and decision points that affect key outcomes and unlock different story paths. Armored Core: Master of Arena features the classic mecha gameplay loop of tinkering, testing, and refining builds, creating an infinite tune-refine-test replay cycle that mech enthusiasts are sure to crave.
